00251 static int __init vmedrv_initialize_module(void)
00252 {
00253     int result = -ENODEV;
00254 
00255     bit3.pci_dev = NULL;
00256     vmedrv_pci_driver.name = vmedrv_name;
00257     result = pci_register_driver(&vmedrv_pci_driver);
00258     if (result < 0) {
00259         printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: unable to register PCI driver\n", vmedrv_name);
00260         goto FAIL_PCI_DRIVER_REGISTRATION;
00261     }
00262     if (bit3.pci_dev == NULL) {
00263         printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: unable to find VME-PCI Bus Adapter.\n", vmedrv_name);
00264         result = -ENODEV;
00265         goto FAIL_DEVICE_DETECTION;
00266     }
00267 
00268     if (vmedrv_major == 0) {
00269         result = alloc_chrdev_region(
00270             &dev, 0, vmedrv_NUMBER_OF_MINOR_IDS, vmedrv_name
00271         );
00272     }
00273     else {
00274         dev = MKDEV(vmedrv_major, 0);
00275         result = register_chrdev_region(
00276             dev, vmedrv_NUMBER_OF_MINOR_IDS, vmedrv_name
00277         );
00278     }
00279     if (result < 0) {
00280         printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: unable to get major %d\n", vmedrv_name, vmedrv_major);
00281         goto FAIL_DRIVER_REGISTRATION;
00282     }
00283     if (vmedrv_major == 0) {
00284         vmedrv_major = MAJOR(dev);
00285     }
00286 
00287     bit3.interrupt_enabling_flags = 0;
00288     bit3.dma_buffer_size = 0;
00289 
00290     bit3.mapped_node_io_base = 0;
00291     bit3.mapping_registers_base = 0;
00292     bit3.dma_mapping_registers_base = 0;
00293     bit3.window_region_base = 0;
00294     module_open_count = 0;
00295     error_interrupt_count = 0;
00296     local_status_on_error = 0;
00297 
00298     bit3.io_node_io_base = (
00299         bit3.pci_dev->resource[bit3_IO_NODE_IO_BASE_INDEX].start
00300     );
00301     bit3.irq = bit3.pci_dev->irq;
00302 
00303     init_waitqueue_head(&vmedrv_dmadone_wait_queue);
00304     init_waitqueue_head(&vmedrv_vmebusirq_wait_queue);
00305 
00306     cdev_init(&cdev, &vmedrv_fops);
00307     cdev.owner = THIS_MODULE;
00308     cdev.ops = &vmedrv_fops;
00309     result = cdev_add(&cdev, dev, vmedrv_NUMBER_OF_MINOR_IDS);
00310     if (result < 0) {
00311         printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: unable to register driver.\n", vmedrv_name);
00312         goto FAIL_CDEV_REGISTRATION;
00313     }
00314 
00315     printk(KERN_INFO "%s: successfully installed at 0x%04x on irq %d (major = %d).\n", 
00316         vmedrv_name, bit3.io_node_io_base, bit3.irq, vmedrv_major
00317     );
00318 
00319     return 0;
00320     
00321   FAIL_CDEV_REGISTRATION:
00322     unregister_chrdev_region(dev, vmedrv_NUMBER_OF_MINOR_IDS);
00323   FAIL_DRIVER_REGISTRATION:
00324     ;
00325   FAIL_DEVICE_DETECTION:
00326     pci_unregister_driver(&vmedrv_pci_driver);
00327   FAIL_PCI_DRIVER_REGISTRATION:
00328     ;
00329 
00330     return result;  
00331 }
00332 
00333 
00334 static void __exit vmedrv_cleanup_module(void)
00335 {
00336     release_dma_buffer();
00337 
00338     cdev_del(&cdev);
00339     unregister_chrdev_region(dev, vmedrv_NUMBER_OF_MINOR_IDS);
00340 
00341     pci_unregister_driver(&vmedrv_pci_driver);
00342 
00343     printk(KERN_INFO "%s: removed.\n", vmedrv_name);
00344 }

00347 module_init(vmedrv_initialize_module);
00348 module_exit(vmedrv_cleanup_module);

00350 
00351 static int vmedrv_open(struct inode* inode, struct file* filep)
00352 {
00353     struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop;
00354     int minor_id, mode, method;
00355 
00356     minor_id = MINOR(inode->i_rdev);
00357     if (minor_id >= vmedrv_NUMBER_OF_MINOR_IDS) {
00358         printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: invalid minor ID.\n", vmedrv_name);
00359         return -ENODEV;
00360     }
00361 
00362     filep->private_data = kmalloc(sizeof(struct dev_prop_t), GFP_KERNEL);
00363     if (filep->private_data == 0) {
00364         printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: unable to allocate memory.", vmedrv_name);
00365         return -ENOMEM;
00366     }
00367     dev_prop = filep->private_data;
00368 
00369     while (module_open_count == 0) {
00370         struct resource* resource;
00371         int result;
00372 
00373         resource = request_region(
00374             bit3.io_node_io_base, bit3_IO_NODE_IO_SIZE, vmedrv_name
00375         );
00376         if (resource == NULL) {
00377             printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: I/O region request fault.\n", vmedrv_name);
00378             result = -EIO;
00379             goto FAIL_REGION_REQUEST;
00380         }
00381 
00382         result = initialize();
00383         if (result < 0) {
00384             printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: initialization fault.\n", vmedrv_name);
00385             goto FAIL_INITIALIZATION;
00386         }
00387 
00388 #ifdef USE_OLD_IRQ
00389         result = request_irq(
00390             bit3.irq, vmedrv_interrupt, 
00391             SA_INTERRUPT | SA_SHIRQ, vmedrv_name, &bit3.dev_id
00392         );
00393 #else
00394         result = request_irq(
00395             bit3.irq, vmedrv_interrupt, 
00396             IRQF_SHARED, vmedrv_name, &bit3.dev_id
00397         );
00398 #endif
00399         if (result < 0) {
00400             printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: IRQ request fault.\n", vmedrv_name);
00401             goto FAIL_IRQ_REQUEST;
00402         }
00403 
00404         break;
00405 
00406       FAIL_IRQ_REQUEST:
00407         ;
00408       FAIL_INITIALIZATION:
00409         if (bit3.window_region_base != 0) {
00410             iounmap(bit3.mapped_node_io_base);
00411             iounmap(bit3.mapping_registers_base);
00412             iounmap(bit3.window_region_base);
00413             bit3.window_region_base = 0;
00414         }
00415         release_region(bit3.io_node_io_base, bit3_IO_NODE_IO_SIZE);
00416       FAIL_REGION_REQUEST:
00417         ;
00418 
00419         return result;
00420     }
00421 
00422     dev_prop->pio_buffer = 0;
00423     dev_prop->number_of_pio_windows = 0;
00424     dev_prop->number_of_mmap_windows = 0;
00425     dev_prop->local_interrupt_client = 0;
00426 
00427     mode = minor_to_access_mode[minor_id];
00428     method = minor_to_transfer_method[minor_id];
00429     set_access_mode(dev_prop, mode);
00430     set_transfer_method(dev_prop, method);
00431     
00432     try_module_get(THIS_MODULE);
00433     module_open_count++;
00434 
00435     return 0;
00436 }
00437 
00438 
00439 static int vmedrv_release(struct inode* inode, struct file* filep)
00440 {
00441     struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop;
00442     dev_prop = filep->private_data;
00443 
00444     module_open_count--;
00445     if (module_open_count == 0) {
00446         disable_normal_interrupt();
00447         disable_error_interrupt();
00448     }
00449 
00450     /* unregister all registered interrupts */
00451     unregister_interrupt_notification(dev_prop, current, 0, 0);
00452 
00453     if (dev_prop->number_of_pio_windows > 0) {
00454         free_windows(dev_prop->pio_window_index, dev_prop->number_of_pio_windows);
00455     }
00456     if (dev_prop->number_of_mmap_windows > 0) {
00457         free_windows(dev_prop->mmap_window_index, dev_prop->number_of_mmap_windows);
00458     }
00459         
00460     if (dev_prop->pio_buffer > 0) {
00461         kfree(dev_prop->pio_buffer);
00462     }
00463     kfree(dev_prop);
00464 
00465     if (module_open_count == 0) {
00466         if (bit3.window_region_base != 0) {
00467             iounmap(bit3.mapped_node_io_base);
00468             iounmap(bit3.mapping_registers_base);
00469             iounmap(bit3.window_region_base);
00470             bit3.window_region_base = 0;
00471         }
00472         free_irq(bit3.irq, &bit3.dev_id);
00473         release_region(bit3.io_node_io_base, bit3_IO_NODE_IO_SIZE);
00474     }
00475 
00476     module_put(THIS_MODULE);
00477 
00478     return 0;
00479 }
00480 
00481 
00482 static ssize_t vmedrv_read(struct file* filep, char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* f_pos)
00483 {
00484     struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop;
00485     unsigned long vme_address;
00486     int total_read_size, read_size, remainder_size;
00487 
00488     dev_prop = filep->private_data;
00489     vme_address = *f_pos;
00490     read_size = 0;
00491     total_read_size = 0;
00492     remainder_size = count;
00493 
00494     if ((count % dev_prop->data_width) != 0) {
00495         return -EINVAL;
00496     }
00497 
00498     while (remainder_size > 0) {
00499         if (
00500             (dev_prop->transfer_method == tmDMA) ||
00501             (dev_prop->transfer_method == tmNBDMA)
00502         ){
00503             read_size = dma_read(dev_prop, buf, vme_address, remainder_size);
00504         }
00505         else if (dev_prop->transfer_method == tmPIO) {
00506             read_size = pio_read(dev_prop, buf, vme_address, remainder_size);
00507         }
00508         else {
00509             return -EINVAL;
00510         }
00511 
00512         if (read_size < 0) {
00513             return read_size;
00514         }
00515         else if (read_size == 0) {
00516             break;
00517         }
00518 
00519         remainder_size -= read_size;
00520         total_read_size += read_size;
00521         vme_address += read_size;
00522         buf += read_size;
00523     }
00524 
00525     *f_pos += total_read_size;
00526 
00527     return total_read_size;
00528 }
00529 
00530 
00531 static ssize_t vmedrv_write(struct file* filep, const char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* f_pos)
00532 {
00533     struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop;
00534     unsigned long vme_address;
00535     int total_written_size, written_size, remainder_size;
00536 
00537     dev_prop = filep->private_data;
00538     vme_address = *f_pos;
00539     written_size = 0;
00540     total_written_size = 0;
00541     remainder_size = count;
00542 
00543     if ((count % dev_prop->data_width) != 0) {
00544         return -EINVAL;
00545     }
00546 
00547     while (remainder_size > 0) {
00548         if (
00549             (dev_prop->transfer_method == tmDMA) ||
00550             (dev_prop->transfer_method == tmNBDMA) 
00551         ){
00552             written_size = dma_write(dev_prop, buf, vme_address, remainder_size);
00553         }
00554         else if (dev_prop->transfer_method == tmPIO) {
00555             written_size = pio_write(dev_prop, buf, vme_address, remainder_size);
00556         }
00557         else {
00558             return -EINVAL;
00559         }
00560 
00561         if (written_size < 0) {
00562             return written_size;
00563         }
00564         else if (written_size == 0) {
00565             break;
00566         }
00567 
00568         remainder_size -= written_size;
00569         total_written_size += written_size;
00570         vme_address += written_size;
00571         buf += written_size;
00572     }
00573 
00574     *f_pos += total_written_size;
00575 
00576     return total_written_size;
00577 }
00578 
00579 
00580 static loff_t vmedrv_lseek(struct file* filep, loff_t offset, int whence)
00581 {
00582     switch (whence) {
00583       case 0: /* SEEK_SET */
00584         filep->f_pos = offset;
00585         break;
00586       case 1: /* SEEK_CUR */
00587         filep->f_pos += offset;
00588         break;
00589       case 2: /* SEEK_END */
00590         return -EINVAL;
00591       default:
00592         return -EINVAL;
00593     };
00594 
00595     return filep->f_pos;
00596 }

00599 #ifdef USE_OLD_IOCTL

00601 {
00602     return vmedrv_unlocked_ioctl(filep, cmd, arg);
00603 }
00604 #endif
00605 
00606 static long vmedrv_unlocked_ioctl(struct file *filep, unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
00607 {
00608     struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop;
00609     int argument_size;
00610     int result = -EINVAL;
00611     int value = 0;
00612     unsigned long uncopied_length;
00613     struct vmedrv_interrupt_property_t interrupt_property;
00614     int irq = 0, vector = 0, signal_id = 0, timeout = 0;
00615     int vector_mask = 0xffff;
00616 
00617     if (_IOC_TYPE(cmd) != VMEDRV_IOC_MAGIC) {
00618         return -EINVAL;
00619     }
00620 
00621     /* read arguments from user area */
00622     if (
00623         (cmd == VMEDRV_IOC_SET_ACCESS_MODE) || 
00624         (cmd == VMEDRV_IOC_SET_TRANSFER_METHOD)
00625     ){
00626         if (get_user(value, (int*) arg) < 0) {
00627             return -EFAULT;
00628         }
00629     }
00630     else if (
00631         (cmd == VMEDRV_IOC_REGISTER_INTERRUPT) ||
00632         (cmd == VMEDRV_IOC_UNREGISTER_INTERRUPT) ||
00633         (cmd == VMEDRV_IOC_WAIT_FOR_INTERRUPT) ||
00634         (cmd == VMEDRV_IOC_CHECK_INTERRUPT) ||
00635         (cmd == VMEDRV_IOC_CLEAR_INTERRUPT) ||
00636         (cmd == VMEDRV_IOC_SET_INTERRUPT_AUTODISABLE) ||
00637         (cmd == VMEDRV_IOC_SET_VECTOR_MASK)
00638     ){
00639         argument_size = sizeof(struct vmedrv_interrupt_property_t);
00640         uncopied_length = copy_from_user(
00641             &interrupt_property, (const __user void *) arg, argument_size
00642         );
00643         if (uncopied_length != 0) {
00644             return -EFAULT;
00645         }
00646 
00647         irq = interrupt_property.irq;
00648         vector = interrupt_property.vector;
00649         signal_id = interrupt_property.signal_id;
00650         timeout = interrupt_property.timeout;
00651         vector_mask = interrupt_property.vector_mask;
00652     }
00653 
00654     dev_prop = filep->private_data;
00655 
00656     switch (cmd) {
00657       case VMEDRV_IOC_SET_ACCESS_MODE:
00658         result = set_access_mode(dev_prop, value);
00659         break;
00660       case VMEDRV_IOC_SET_TRANSFER_METHOD:
00661         result = set_transfer_method(dev_prop, value);
00662         break;
00663       case VMEDRV_IOC_PROBE:
00664         result = probe(dev_prop, (__user vmedrv_word_access_t*) arg);
00665         break;
00666       case VMEDRV_IOC_REGISTER_INTERRUPT:
00667         result = register_interrupt_notification(dev_prop, current, irq, vector, signal_id);
00668         break;
00669       case VMEDRV_IOC_UNREGISTER_INTERRUPT:
00670         result = unregister_interrupt_notification(dev_prop, current, irq, vector);
00671         break;
00672       case VMEDRV_IOC_WAIT_FOR_INTERRUPT:
00673         result = wait_for_interrupt_notification(current, irq, vector, timeout);
00674         break;
00675       case VMEDRV_IOC_CHECK_INTERRUPT:
00676         result = check_interrupt_notification(irq, vector);
00677         break;
00678       case VMEDRV_IOC_CLEAR_INTERRUPT:
00679         result = clear_interrupt_notification(irq, vector);
00680         break;
00681       case VMEDRV_IOC_SET_INTERRUPT_AUTODISABLE:
00682         result = set_interrupt_autodisable(irq, vector);
00683         break;
00684       case VMEDRV_IOC_ENABLE_INTERRUPT:
00685         result = enable_normal_interrupt();
00686         break;
00687       case VMEDRV_IOC_DISABLE_INTERRUPT:
00688         result = disable_normal_interrupt();
00689         break;
00690       case VMEDRV_IOC_SET_VECTOR_MASK:
00691         result = set_vector_mask(irq, vector, vector_mask);
00692         break;
00693       case VMEDRV_IOC_ENABLE_ERROR_INTERRUPT:
00694         result = enable_error_interrupt();
00695         break;
00696       case VMEDRV_IOC_DISABLE_ERROR_INTERRUPT:
00697         result = disable_error_interrupt();
00698         break;
00699       case VMEDRV_IOC_RESET_ADAPTER:
00700         result = reset_adapter();
00701         break;
00702       default:
00703         return -EINVAL;
00704     }
00705 
00706     return result;
00707 }
00708 
00709 
00710 
00711 static int vmedrv_mmap(struct file* filep, struct vm_area_struct* vma)
00712 {
00713     unsigned long vme_address, size;
00714     unsigned long physical_address, page_frame_number;
00715     struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop;
00716 
00717     dev_prop = filep->private_data;
00718     size = vma->vm_end - vma->vm_start;
00719     vme_address = vma->vm_pgoff * PAGE_SIZE;
00720 
00721     DEBUG_MAP(printk(KERN_DEBUG "mapping vme memory...\n"));
00722     DEBUG_MAP(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  vme address: 0x%lx\n", vme_address));
00723     DEBUG_MAP(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  mapping size: 0x%lx\n", size));
00724 
00725     if (vme_address & (PAGE_SIZE - 1)) {
00726         /* offset address must be aligned with the MMU page */
00727         return -ENXIO;
00728     }
00729     
00730     if (dev_prop->number_of_mmap_windows > 0) {
00731         /* FIXME: mmap() can be called only once every open() */
00732         return -ENXIO;
00733     }
00734 
00735     dev_prop->number_of_mmap_windows = ((unsigned long) size - 1) / (unsigned long) bit3_WINDOW_SIZE + 1;
00736     dev_prop->mmap_window_index = allocate_windows(dev_prop->number_of_mmap_windows);
00737     if (dev_prop->mmap_window_index < 0) {
00738         dev_prop->number_of_mmap_windows = 0;
00739         return dev_prop->mmap_window_index;
00740     }
00741 
00742     DEBUG_MAP(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  map pages: %d\n", dev_prop->number_of_mmap_windows));
00743     DEBUG_MAP(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  window index: %d\n", dev_prop->mmap_window_index));
00744 
00745     map_windows(vme_address, size, dev_prop->mmap_window_index, dev_prop->mapping_flags);
00746     physical_address = (
00747         bit3.physical_window_region_base + 
00748         dev_prop->mmap_window_index * bit3_WINDOW_SIZE +
00749         (vme_address & bit3_PAGE_OFFSET_MASK)
00750     );
00751     page_frame_number = physical_address >> PAGE_SHIFT;
00752 
00753     DEBUG_MAP(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  physical address: 0x%lx\n", physical_address));
00754 
00755     if (remap_pfn_range(vma, vma->vm_start, page_frame_number, size, vma->vm_page_prot) < 0) {
00756         return -EAGAIN;
00757     }
00758 
00759     DEBUG_MAP(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  mapped address: 0x%lx\n", vma->vm_start));
00760 
00761     return 0;
00762 }
00763 
00764 
00765 static unsigned int vmedrv_poll(struct file* filep, poll_table* table)
00766 {
00767     struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop = filep->private_data;
00768     struct local_interrupt_client_t* local_interrupt_client;
00769     unsigned int mask = 0;
00770 
00771     poll_wait(filep, &vmedrv_vmebusirq_wait_queue, table);
00772 
00773     for (
00774         local_interrupt_client = dev_prop->local_interrupt_client;
00775         local_interrupt_client != 0;
00776         local_interrupt_client = local_interrupt_client->next
00777     ){
00778         if (local_interrupt_client->interrupt_client->interrupt_count > 0) {
00779             mask |= POLLIN | POLLRDNORM;
00780         }
00781     }
00782 
00783     return mask;
00784 }
00785 
00786 
00787 #ifdef USE_OLD_IRQ
00788 static irqreturn_t vmedrv_interrupt(int irq, void* dev_id, struct pt_regs* regs)
00789 #else
00790 static irqreturn_t vmedrv_interrupt(int irq, void* dev_id)
00791 #endif
00792 {
00793     unsigned status;
00794 
00795     DEBUG_INT(printk(KERN_DEBUG "interrupt handled.\n"));
00796 
00797     if (module_open_count <= 0) {
00798         /* note that access to the VME card unavailable */
00799         return IRQ_NONE;
00800     }
00801 
00802     /* check whether the PCI card is generating an interrupt */
00803     status = ioread8(bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regINTERRUPT_CONTROL);
00804     if (! (status & icINTERRUPT_ACTIVE)) {
00805         DEBUG_INT(printk(KERN_DEBUG "the card is not generating an interrupt.\n"));
00806         return IRQ_NONE;
00807     }
00808 
00809     /* checek for a error interrupt */
00810     status = ioread8(bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regLOCAL_STATUS);
00811     if (status & (lsERROR_BITS & ~lsRECEIVING_PR_INTERRUPT)) {
00812         acknowledge_error_interrupt(status);
00813         return IRQ_HANDLED;
00814     }
00815     
00816     /* check for a PR interrupt */
00817     if (status & lsRECEIVING_PR_INTERRUPT) {
00818         acknowledge_pr_interrupt(status);
00819         return IRQ_HANDLED;
00820     }
00821 
00822     /* check for a DMA DONE interrupt */
00823     if (bit3.is_dma_available) {
00824         status = ioread8(bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regDMA_COMMAND);
00825         if ((status & dcDMA_DONE_FLAG) && (status & dcENABLE_DMA_DONE_INTERRUPT)) {
00826             acknowledge_dma_interrupt(status);
00827             return IRQ_HANDLED;
00828         }
00829     }
00830 
00831     /* check for a PT interrupt */
00832     status = ioread8(bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regREMOTE_STATUS);
00833     if (status & rsRECEIVING_PT_INTERRUPT) {
00834         acknowledge_pt_interrupt(status);
00835         return IRQ_HANDLED;
00836     }
00837 
00838     /* check for a VME backplane interrupt */    
00839     status = ioread8(bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regINTERRUPT_STATUS);
00840     if (status) {
00841         acknowledge_vme_interrupt(status);
00842         return IRQ_HANDLED;
00843     }
00844 
00845     printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: Unknown interrupt handled...\n", vmedrv_name);
00846     return IRQ_HANDLED;
00847 }
00848 
00849 
00850 static int vmedrv_pci_probe(struct pci_dev* pci_dev, const struct pci_device_id* id)
00851 {
00852     int result;
00853 
00854     printk(
00855         KERN_INFO "%s: %s is detected at ioport 0x%04lx on irq %d.\n", 
00856         vmedrv_name, 
00857         vmedrv_model_name_table[id->driver_data],
00858         (unsigned long) pci_dev->resource[bit3_IO_NODE_IO_BASE_INDEX].start,
00859         pci_dev->irq
00860     );
00861     printk(
00862         KERN_INFO "  I/O Mapped Node at 0x%04lx.\n", 
00863         (unsigned long) pci_dev->resource[bit3_IO_NODE_IO_BASE_INDEX].start
00864     );
00865     printk(
00866         KERN_INFO "  Memory Mapped Node at 0x%04lx.\n", 
00867         (unsigned long) pci_dev->resource[bit3_MAPPED_NODE_IO_BASE_INDEX].start
00868     );
00869     printk(
00870         KERN_INFO "  Mapping Register at 0x%04lx.\n", 
00871         (unsigned long) pci_dev->resource[bit3_MAPPING_REGISTERS_BASE_INDEX].start
00872     );
00873     printk(
00874         KERN_INFO "  Remote Memory at 0x%04lx.\n", 
00875         (unsigned long) pci_dev->resource[bit3_WINDOW_REGION_BASE_INDEX].start
00876     );
00877 
00878     if (bit3_card_count != target_card_number) {
00879         bit3_card_count++;
00880         printk(KERN_INFO "%s: this is not our target card...\n", vmedrv_name);
00881         return -ENODEV;
00882     }
00883     bit3_card_count++;
00884 
00885     bit3.pci_dev = pci_dev;
00886     bit3.is_dma_available = (id->device == di616) ? 0 : 1;
00887 
00888     result = pci_enable_device(pci_dev);
00889     if (result < 0) {
00890         printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: enabling device failed.\n", vmedrv_name);
00891     }
00892 
00893     /* force the DMA buffer be allocated in 32bit accessible range */
00894 #ifdef USE_OLD_DMABITMASK
00895     pci_set_dma_mask(pci_dev, DMA_32BIT_MASK);
00896 #else
00897     pci_set_dma_mask(pci_dev, DMA_BIT_MASK(32));
00898 #endif
00899 
00900 
00901     return result;
00902 }
00903 
00904 
00905 static void vmedrv_pci_remove(struct pci_dev* pci_dev)
00906 {
00907     if (pci_dev == bit3.pci_dev) {
00908         printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: device removed.\n", vmedrv_name);
00909     }
00910 }
00911 
00912 
00913 static int initialize(void)
00914 {
00915     unsigned status;
00916 
00917     /* read PCI configurations */
00918     bit3.mapped_node_io_base = ioremap_nocache(
00919         bit3.pci_dev->resource[bit3_MAPPED_NODE_IO_BASE_INDEX].start,
00920         bit3_MAPPED_NODE_IO_SIZE
00921     );
00922     bit3.mapping_registers_base = ioremap_nocache(
00923         bit3.pci_dev->resource[bit3_MAPPING_REGISTERS_BASE_INDEX].start,
00924         bit3_MAPPING_REGISTERS_SIZE
00925     );
00926     bit3.window_region_base = ioremap_nocache(
00927         bit3.pci_dev->resource[bit3_WINDOW_REGION_BASE_INDEX].start,
00928         bit3_WINDOW_REGION_SIZE
00929     );
00930 
00931     bit3.physical_window_region_base = (
00932         bit3.pci_dev->resource[bit3_WINDOW_REGION_BASE_INDEX].start
00933     );
00934     bit3.dma_mapping_registers_base = (
00935         bit3.mapping_registers_base + bit3_DMA_MAPPING_REGISTERS_BASE_OFFSET
00936     );
00937 
00938     DEBUG_CONFIG(printk(KERN_DEBUG "remapping pci memories...\n"));
00939     DEBUG_CONFIG(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  memory mapped node: --> 0x%08lx\n", bit3.mapped_node_io_base));
00940     DEBUG_CONFIG(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  mapping regs: --> 0x%08lx\n", bit3.mapping_registers_base));
00941     DEBUG_CONFIG(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  window base: --> 0x%08lx\n", bit3.window_region_base));
00942     
00943     /* check whether remote power is on */
00944 #if 0
00945     status = inb(bit3.io_node_io_base + regLOCAL_STATUS);
00946 #else
00947     status = ioread8(bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regLOCAL_STATUS);
00948 #endif
00949     if (status & lsREMOTE_BUS_POWER_OFF) {
00950         printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: ERROR: VME chassis power is off.\n", vmedrv_name);
00951         printk(KERN_WARNING "  (or I/O cable is not connected, or SYSRESET is active.)\n");
00952         printk(KERN_WARNING "  Local Status Register: 0x%02x\n", status);
00953         return -EIO;
00954     }
00955 
00956     /* clear error caused by the power on transition */
00957 #if 0
00958     status = inb(bit3.io_node_io_base  + regREMOTE_STATUS);
00959     rmb();
00960     outb(bit3.io_node_io_base  + regLOCAL_COMMAND, lcCLEAR_STATUS);
00961     wmb();
00962     status = inb(bit3.io_node_io_base  + regLOCAL_STATUS);
00963 #else
00964     status = ioread8(bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regREMOTE_STATUS);
00965     rmb();
00966     iowrite8(lcCLEAR_STATUS, bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regLOCAL_COMMAND);
00967     wmb();
00968     status = ioread8(bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regLOCAL_STATUS);
00969 #endif
00970     
00971     /* make sure no error bits are set */
00972     if (status & lsERROR_BITS) {
00973         if (status & lsINTERFACE_PARITY_ERROR) {
00974             printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: ERROR: interface parity error.\n", vmedrv_name);
00975         }
00976         if (status & lsREMOTE_BUS_ERROR) {
00977             printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: ERROR: remote bus error.\n", vmedrv_name);
00978         }
00979         if (status & lsRECEIVING_PR_INTERRUPT) {
00980             printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: ERROR: receiving PR interrupt.\n", vmedrv_name);
00981         }
00982         if (status & lsINTERFACE_TIMEOUT) {
00983             printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: ERROR: interface timed out.\n", vmedrv_name);
00984         }
00985         if (status & lsLRC_ERROR) {
00986             printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: ERROR: LRC(Longitudinal Redundancy Check) error.\n", vmedrv_name);
00987         }
00988         if (status & lsREMOTE_BUS_POWER_OFF) {
00989             printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: ERROR: remote bus power off or I/O cable is off.\n", vmedrv_name);
00990         }
00991 
00992         printk(KERN_WARNING "  Local Status Register: 0x%02x\n", status);
00993 
00994         status = inb(bit3.io_node_io_base  + regADAPTER_ID);
00995         printk(KERN_WARNING "  Adapter ID (I/O): 0x%02x\n", status);
00996         status = ioread8(bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regADAPTER_ID);
00997         printk(KERN_WARNING "  Adapter ID (mem): 0x%02x\n", status);
00998 
00999         return -EIO;
01000     }
01001     
01002     DEBUG_CONFIG(printk("%s: remote VME card successfully initialized\n", vmedrv_name));
01003 
01004     return 0;
01005 }
01006 
01007 
01008 static int set_access_mode(struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop, int mode)
01009 {
01010     if (mode >= vmedrv_NUMBER_OF_ACCESS_MODES) {
01011         return -EINVAL;
01012     }
01013 
01014     dev_prop->address_modifier = vmedrv_config_table[mode].address_modifier;
01015     dev_prop->dma_address_modifier = vmedrv_config_table[mode].dma_address_modifier;
01016     dev_prop->data_width = vmedrv_config_table[mode].data_width;
01017     dev_prop->function_code = vmedrv_config_table[mode].function_code;
01018     dev_prop->byte_swapping = vmedrv_config_table[mode].byte_swapping;
01019 
01020     dev_prop->mapping_flags = (
01021         (dev_prop->address_modifier << bit3_AM_SHIFT) | 
01022         (dev_prop->function_code << bit3_FUNCTION_SHIFT) | 
01023         (dev_prop->byte_swapping << bit3_BYTESWAP_SHIFT) 
01024     );
01025 
01026     dev_prop->dma_mapping_flags = (
01027         (dev_prop->byte_swapping & bit3_DMA_BYTESWAP_MASK) << bit3_DMA_BYTESWAP_SHIFT
01028     );
01029 
01030     /*DEBUG_CONFIG(printk(KERN_DEBUG "setting access modes...\n"));*/
01031     /*DEBUG_CONFIG(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  address modifier: 0x%02x\n", dev_prop->address_modifier));*/
01032     /*DEBUG_CONFIG(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  data width: %d\n", dev_prop->data_width));*/
01033     /*DEBUG_CONFIG(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  function code: 0x%02x\n", dev_prop->function_code));*/
01034     /*DEBUG_CONFIG(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  byte swapping: 0x%02x\n", dev_prop->byte_swapping));*/
01035 
01036     return 0;
01037 }
01038 
01039 
01040 static int set_transfer_method(struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop, int method)
01041 {
01042     if (method == VMEDRV_PIO) {
01043         dev_prop->transfer_method = tmPIO;
01044         DEBUG_CONFIG(printk(KERN_DEBUG "transfer mode is set to PIO.\n"));
01045     }
01046     else if (method == VMEDRV_DMA) {
01047         if (dev_prop->dma_address_modifier == amINVALID) {
01048             return -EINVAL;
01049         }
01050         if (bit3.is_dma_available) {
01051             dev_prop->transfer_method = tmDMA;
01052             DEBUG_CONFIG(printk(KERN_DEBUG "transfer mode is set to DMA.\n"));
01053         }
01054         else {
01055             dev_prop->transfer_method = tmPIO;
01056             DEBUG_CONFIG(printk(KERN_DEBUG "DMA transfer mode is requested, but not available.\n"));
01057             DEBUG_CONFIG(printk(KERN_DEBUG "transfer mode is set to PIO.\n"));
01058         }
01059     }
01060     else if (method == VMEDRV_NBDMA) {
01061         if (dev_prop->address_modifier == amINVALID) {
01062             return -EINVAL;
01063         }
01064         dev_prop->transfer_method = tmNBDMA;
01065         DEBUG_CONFIG(printk(KERN_DEBUG "transfer mode is set to Non-Blocking DMA.\n"));
01066     }
01067     else {
01068         return -EINVAL;
01069     }
01070 
01071     return 0;
01072 }
01073 
01074 
01075 static int probe(struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop, __user vmedrv_word_access_t* word_access)
01076 {
01077     int result;
01078     unsigned long address = 0, data = 0;
01079 
01080     if (get_user(address, &word_access->address) < 0) {
01081         return -EFAULT;
01082     }
01083     if (put_user(data, &word_access->data) < 0) {
01084         return -EFAULT;
01085     }
01086 
01087     result = pio_read(dev_prop, (__user char*) &word_access->data, address, 1);
01088     if (result >= 0) {
01089         result = 0;
01090     }
01091 
01092     return result;
01093 }
01094 
01095 
01096 static int pio_read(struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop, char* buf, unsigned long vme_address, int count)
01097 {
01098     unsigned long offset_address;
01099     unsigned long size, read_size;
01100     unsigned long uncopied_length;
01101     void* window_address;
01102     void* pio_buf;
01103     unsigned long pio_buf_data_size, pio_buf_index;
01104     unsigned status;
01105     int result;
01106 
01107     /* allocate PIO buffer and mapping windows, if it has not been yet */
01108     if ((result = prepare_pio(dev_prop)) < 0) {
01109         return result;
01110     }
01111 
01112     /* map windows */
01113     offset_address = vme_address & bit3_PAGE_OFFSET_MASK;
01114     if (offset_address + count <= bit3_WINDOW_SIZE * dev_prop->number_of_pio_windows) {
01115         size = count;
01116     }
01117     else {
01118         size = bit3_WINDOW_SIZE * dev_prop->number_of_pio_windows - offset_address;
01119     }
01120     window_address = map_windows(vme_address, size, dev_prop->pio_window_index, dev_prop->mapping_flags);
01121     
01122     /* read from mapped windows */
01123     pio_buf = dev_prop->pio_buffer;
01124     pio_buf_data_size = 0;
01125     pio_buf_index = 0;
01126     for (read_size = 0; read_size < size; read_size += dev_prop->data_width) {
01127         if (dev_prop->data_width == dwWORD) {
01128             ((unsigned short *) pio_buf)[pio_buf_index] = ioread16(window_address);
01129         }
01130         else if (dev_prop->data_width == dwLONG) {
01131             ((unsigned int *) pio_buf)[pio_buf_index] = ioread32(window_address);
01132         }
01133 
01134         window_address += dev_prop->data_width;
01135         pio_buf_data_size += dev_prop->data_width;
01136         pio_buf_index++;
01137 
01138         if (pio_buf_data_size + dwLONG >= PIO_BUFFER_SIZE) {
01139             uncopied_length = copy_to_user(buf, pio_buf, pio_buf_data_size);
01140             if (uncopied_length > 0) {
01141                 return -EFAULT;
01142             }
01143             buf += pio_buf_data_size;
01144             pio_buf_data_size = 0;
01145             pio_buf_index = 0;
01146         }
01147     }
01148 
01149     uncopied_length = copy_to_user(buf, pio_buf, pio_buf_data_size);
01150     if (uncopied_length > 0) {
01151         return -EFAULT;
01152     }
01153 
01154     /* error check */
01155     status = ioread8(bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regLOCAL_STATUS);
01156     rmb();
01157     iowrite8(lcCLEAR_STATUS, bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regLOCAL_COMMAND);
01158     if (status & lsINTERFACE_TIMEOUT) {
01159         return -ETIMEDOUT;
01160     }
01161     if (status & lsERROR_BITS) {
01162         printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: VME I/O failed.\n", vmedrv_name);
01163         printk(KERN_WARNING "  Local Status Register: 0x%02x\n", status);
01164         return -EIO;
01165     }
01166 
01167     return read_size;
01168 }
01169 
01170 
01171 static int pio_write(struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop, const char* buf, unsigned long vme_address, int count)
01172 {
01173     unsigned long offset_address;
01174     unsigned long size, remain_size;
01175     unsigned long uncopied_length;
01176     void* window_address;
01177     void* pio_buf;
01178     unsigned long pio_buf_data_size, pio_buf_index;
01179     unsigned status;
01180     int result;
01181 
01182     /* allocate PIO buffer and mapping windows, if it has not been yet */
01183     if ((result = prepare_pio(dev_prop)) < 0) {
01184         return result;
01185     }
01186 
01187     /* map windows */
01188     offset_address = vme_address & bit3_PAGE_OFFSET_MASK;
01189     if (offset_address + count <= bit3_WINDOW_SIZE * dev_prop->number_of_pio_windows) {
01190         size = count;
01191     }
01192     else {
01193         size = bit3_WINDOW_SIZE * dev_prop->number_of_pio_windows - offset_address;
01194     }
01195     window_address = map_windows(vme_address, size, dev_prop->pio_window_index, dev_prop->mapping_flags);
01196     
01197     /* write to mapped windows */
01198     pio_buf = dev_prop->pio_buffer;
01199     pio_buf_data_size = 0;
01200     pio_buf_index = 0;
01201     for (remain_size = size; remain_size > 0; remain_size -= dev_prop->data_width) {
01202         if (pio_buf_data_size <= 0) {
01203             if (remain_size < PIO_BUFFER_SIZE) {
01204                 pio_buf_data_size = remain_size;
01205             }
01206             else {
01207                 pio_buf_data_size = PIO_BUFFER_SIZE;
01208             }
01209             uncopied_length = copy_from_user(pio_buf, buf, pio_buf_data_size);
01210             if (uncopied_length > 0) {
01211                 return -EFAULT;
01212             }
01213             buf += pio_buf_data_size;
01214             pio_buf_index = 0;
01215         }
01216 
01217         if (dev_prop->data_width == dwWORD) {
01218             iowrite16(
01219                 ((unsigned short *) pio_buf)[pio_buf_index], window_address
01220             );
01221         }
01222         else if (dev_prop->data_width == dwLONG) {
01223             iowrite32(
01224                 ((unsigned int *) pio_buf)[pio_buf_index], window_address
01225             );
01226         }
01227 
01228         window_address += dev_prop->data_width;
01229         pio_buf_data_size -= dev_prop->data_width;
01230         pio_buf_index++;
01231     }
01232 
01233     /* error check */
01234     status = ioread8(bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regLOCAL_STATUS);
01235     rmb();
01236     iowrite8(lcCLEAR_STATUS, bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regLOCAL_COMMAND);
01237     if (status & lsINTERFACE_TIMEOUT) {
01238         return -ETIMEDOUT;
01239     }
01240     if (status & lsERROR_BITS) {
01241         printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: VME I/O failed.\n", vmedrv_name);
01242         printk(KERN_WARNING "  Local Status Register: 0x%02x\n", status);
01243         return -EIO;
01244     }
01245 
01246     return size;
01247 }
01248 
01249 
01250 static int prepare_pio(struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop)
01251 {
01252     /* allocate PIO buffer, if it has not been allocated. */
01253     DEBUG_PIO(printk(KERN_DEBUG "allocating PIO buffer\n"));
01254     DEBUG_PIO(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  size=%d\n", PIO_BUFFER_SIZE));
01255     if (dev_prop->pio_buffer == 0) {
01256         dev_prop->pio_buffer = kmalloc(PIO_BUFFER_SIZE, GFP_KERNEL);
01257         if (dev_prop->pio_buffer == 0) {
01258             printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: unable to allocate PIO buffer.", vmedrv_name);
01259             printk(KERN_WARNING "  requested size: %d\n", PIO_BUFFER_SIZE);
01260             return -ENOMEM;
01261         }
01262     }    
01263     DEBUG_PIO(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  ok, address=%0x\n", dev_prop->pio_buffer));
01264 
01265     /* allocate PIO windows, if it has not been allocated. */
01266     if (dev_prop->number_of_pio_windows == 0) {
01267         DEBUG_PIO(printk(KERN_DEBUG "allocating PIO windows\n"));
01268         DEBUG_PIO(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  size=%d\n", PIO_WINDOW_PAGES));
01269         dev_prop->pio_window_index = allocate_windows(PIO_WINDOW_PAGES);
01270         if (dev_prop->pio_window_index < 0) {
01271             return dev_prop->pio_window_index;
01272         }
01273         DEBUG_PIO(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  ok, start_index=%d\n", dev_prop->pio_window_index));
01274         dev_prop->number_of_pio_windows = PIO_WINDOW_PAGES;
01275     }
01276 
01277     return 0;
01278 }
01279 
01280 static int allocate_windows(int number_of_windows)
01281 {
01282     int number_of_free_windows;
01283     int window_index = -ENOMEM;
01284     int i;
01285 
01286     number_of_free_windows = 0;
01287     for (i = 0; i < bit3_NUMBER_OF_WINDOWS; i++) {
01288         if (bit3.window_status_table[i] != 0) {
01289             number_of_free_windows = 0;
01290             continue;
01291         }
01292 
01293         if (number_of_free_windows == 0) {
01294             window_index = i;
01295         }
01296 
01297         number_of_free_windows++;
01298         if (number_of_free_windows == number_of_windows) {
01299             break;
01300         }
01301     }
01302 
01303     if (i == bit3_NUMBER_OF_WINDOWS) {
01304         return -ENOMEM;
01305     }
01306     
01307     for (i = 0; i < number_of_windows; i++) {
01308         bit3.window_status_table[window_index + i] = 1;
01309     }
01310 
01311     return window_index;
01312 }
01313 
01314 
01315 static void free_windows(int window_index, int number_of_windows)
01316 {
01317     int i;
01318     for (i = 0; i < number_of_windows; i++) {
01319         bit3.window_status_table[window_index + i] = 0;
01320     }
01321 }
01322 
01323 
01324 static void* map_windows(unsigned vme_address, unsigned size, unsigned window_index, unsigned flags) 
01325 {
01326     unsigned base_address, offset_address;
01327     unsigned number_of_windows;
01328     void* window_address;
01329     int i;
01330 
01331     base_address = vme_address & bit3_PAGE_BASE_MASK;
01332     offset_address = vme_address & bit3_PAGE_OFFSET_MASK;
01333     number_of_windows = ((unsigned long) size - 1) / (unsigned long) bit3_WINDOW_SIZE + 1;
01334     window_address = bit3.window_region_base + bit3_WINDOW_SIZE * window_index + offset_address;
01335 
01336     for (i = 0; i < number_of_windows; i++) {
01337         iowrite32(
01338             base_address | flags, 
01339             bit3.mapping_registers_base + bit3_MAPPING_REGISTER_WIDTH * window_index
01340         );
01341         base_address += bit3_WINDOW_SIZE;
01342         window_index++;
01343     }
01344 
01345     return window_address;
01346 }
01347 
01348 
01349 static int enable_normal_interrupt(void)
01350 {
01351     bit3.interrupt_enabling_flags |= icNORMAL_INTERRUPT_ENABLE;
01352     iowrite8(
01353         bit3.interrupt_enabling_flags,
01354         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regINTERRUPT_CONTROL
01355     );
01356 
01357     DEBUG_INT(printk(KERN_DEBUG "normal interrupt enabled.\n"));
01358 
01359     return 0;
01360 }
01361 
01362 
01363 static int disable_normal_interrupt(void)
01364 {
01365     bit3.interrupt_enabling_flags &= ~icNORMAL_INTERRUPT_ENABLE;
01366     iowrite8(
01367         bit3.interrupt_enabling_flags,
01368         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regINTERRUPT_CONTROL
01369     );
01370 
01371     DEBUG_INT(printk(KERN_DEBUG "normal interrupt disabled.\n"));
01372 
01373     return 0;
01374 }
01375 
01376 
01377 static int enable_error_interrupt(void)
01378 {
01379     bit3.interrupt_enabling_flags |= icERROR_INTERRUPT_ENABLE;
01380     iowrite8(
01381         bit3.interrupt_enabling_flags,
01382         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regINTERRUPT_CONTROL
01383     );
01384 
01385     return 0;
01386 }
01387 
01388 
01389 static int disable_error_interrupt(void)
01390 {
01391     bit3.interrupt_enabling_flags &= ~icERROR_INTERRUPT_ENABLE;
01392     iowrite8(
01393         bit3.interrupt_enabling_flags,
01394         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regINTERRUPT_CONTROL
01395     );
01396 
01397     return 0;
01398 }
01399 
01400 
01401 static void save_interrupt_flags(void)
01402 {
01403     bit3.saved_interrupt_flags = bit3.interrupt_enabling_flags;
01404     DEBUG_INT(printk(
01405         KERN_DEBUG "interrupt flags are saved: 0x%02x\n", 
01406         bit3.interrupt_enabling_flags
01407     ));
01408 }
01409 
01410 
01411 static void restore_interrupt_flags(void)
01412 {
01413     if (bit3.saved_interrupt_flags != bit3.interrupt_enabling_flags) {
01414         bit3.interrupt_enabling_flags = bit3.saved_interrupt_flags;
01415         iowrite8(
01416             bit3.interrupt_enabling_flags,
01417             bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regINTERRUPT_CONTROL
01418         );      
01419     }
01420 
01421     DEBUG_INT(printk(
01422         KERN_DEBUG "interrupt flags are restored: 0x%02x\n", 
01423         bit3.interrupt_enabling_flags
01424     ));
01425 }
01426 
01427 
01428 static int acknowledge_error_interrupt(unsigned local_status)
01429 {
01430     error_interrupt_count++;
01431     local_status_on_error = local_status;
01432 
01433     printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: error interrupt handled.\n", vmedrv_name);
01434     printk(KERN_WARNING "  Local Status Register: 0x%02x\n", local_status);
01435     if (local_status & lsINTERFACE_PARITY_ERROR) {
01436         printk(KERN_WARNING "  Fiber-Optic Interface Data Error\n");
01437     }
01438     if (local_status & lsREMOTE_BUS_ERROR) {
01439         printk(KERN_WARNING "  Remote Bus Error\n");
01440     }
01441     if (local_status & lsINTERFACE_TIMEOUT) {
01442         printk(KERN_WARNING "  Interface Timeout\n");
01443     }
01444     if (local_status & lsREMOTE_BUS_POWER_OFF) {
01445         printk(KERN_WARNING "  Remote Bus Power Off or I/O Cable Is Off\n");
01446     }
01447 
01448     iowrite8(lcCLEAR_STATUS, bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regLOCAL_COMMAND);
01449     if (local_status & lsINTERFACE_TIMEOUT) {
01450         /* flush the interface error */
01451         ioread8(bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regREMOTE_STATUS);
01452     }
01453 
01454     return 0;
01455 }
01456 
01457 
01458 static int acknowledge_pt_interrupt(unsigned local_status)
01459 {
01460     DEBUG_INT(printk(KERN_DEBUG "pt interrupt handled...\n"));
01461 
01462     iowrite8(lcCLEAR_PR_INTERRUPT, bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regLOCAL_COMMAND);
01463 
01464     return 0;
01465 }
01466 
01467 
01468 static int acknowledge_dma_interrupt(unsigned dma_status)
01469 {
01470     DEBUG_INT(printk(KERN_DEBUG "DEBUG_INT: dma interrupt handled...\n"));
01471     DEBUG_DMA(printk(KERN_DEBUG "DEBUG_DMA: dma interrupt handled...\n"));
01472 
01473     /* clear the DMA Command Register */
01474     iowrite8(0, bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regDMA_COMMAND);  
01475 
01476     /* wake up the process */
01477     is_dma_running = 0;
01478     wake_up(&vmedrv_dmadone_wait_queue);
01479 
01480     return 0;
01481 }
01482 
01483 
01484 static int acknowledge_pr_interrupt(unsigned remote_status)
01485 {
01486     DEBUG_INT(printk(KERN_DEBUG "pr interrupt handled...\n"));
01487 
01488     iowrite8(
01489         rcCLEAR_PT_INTERRUPT,
01490         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regREMOTE_COMMAND_1
01491     );
01492     
01493     return 0;
01494 }
01495 
01496 
01497 static int acknowledge_vme_interrupt(unsigned interrupt_status)
01498 {
01499     unsigned irq, vector;
01500     struct interrupt_client_t* interrupt_client;
01501     struct task_struct* task;
01502     int signal_id;
01503     int priv;
01504 
01505     DEBUG_INT(printk(KERN_DEBUG "vme interrupt handled...\n"));
01506 
01507     for (irq = 1; irq < vmeNUMBER_OF_IRQ_LINES; irq++) {
01508         /* check whether this IRQ is asserted */
01509         if (! (interrupt_status & (0x0001 << irq))) {
01510             continue;
01511         }
01512         DEBUG_INT(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  irq = %d\n", irq));
01513 
01514         /* acknowledge IRQ request (send IACK) */
01515         iowrite8(irq, bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regREMOTE_COMMAND_1);
01516         wmb();
01517         vector = ioread16(bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regIACK_READ);
01518         DEBUG_INT(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  vector = 0x%04x\n", vector));
01519 
01520         /* send signal to registered processes */
01521         interrupt_client = bit3.interrupt_client_list[irq];
01522         while (interrupt_client != 0) {
01523             if ((vector & interrupt_client->vector_mask) == (interrupt_client->vector & interrupt_client->vector_mask)) {
01524                 if (interrupt_client->autodisable_flag != 0) {
01525                     disable_normal_interrupt();
01526                     DEBUG_INT(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  auto-disabled.\n"));
01527                 }
01528 
01529                 task = interrupt_client->task;
01530                 signal_id = interrupt_client->signal_id;
01531                 if (signal_id > 0) {
01532                     send_sig(signal_id, task, priv = 1);
01533                     DEBUG_INT(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  send signal.\n"));
01534                 }
01535                 else {
01536                     interrupt_client->interrupt_count++;
01537                     wake_up_interruptible(&vmedrv_vmebusirq_wait_queue);
01538                     DEBUG_INT(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  wake up.\n"));
01539                 }
01540             }
01541             interrupt_client = interrupt_client->next;
01542         }
01543     }
01544     
01545     DEBUG_INT(printk(KERN_DEBUG "now exit vme interrupt handling routine.\n"));
01546 
01547     return 0;
01548 }
01549 
01550 
01551 static int register_interrupt_notification(struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop, struct task_struct* task, int irq, int vector, int signal_id)
01552 {
01553     struct interrupt_client_t* interrupt_client;
01554     struct local_interrupt_client_t* local_interrupt_client;
01555 
01556     if ((irq < 1) || (irq >= vmeNUMBER_OF_IRQ_LINES)) {
01557         return -EINVAL;
01558     }
01559 
01560     interrupt_client = kmalloc(sizeof(struct interrupt_client_t), GFP_KERNEL);
01561     local_interrupt_client = kmalloc(sizeof(struct local_interrupt_client_t), GFP_KERNEL);
01562     if ((interrupt_client == 0) || (local_interrupt_client == 0)) {
01563         printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: unable to allocate memory for interrupt client entry.\n", vmedrv_name);
01564         return -ENOMEM;
01565     }
01566 
01567     interrupt_client->task = task;
01568     interrupt_client->irq = irq;
01569     interrupt_client->vector = vector;
01570     interrupt_client->signal_id = signal_id;
01571     interrupt_client->interrupt_count = 0;
01572     interrupt_client->autodisable_flag = 0;
01573     interrupt_client->vector_mask = 0xffff;
01574 
01575     interrupt_client->next = bit3.interrupt_client_list[irq];
01576     bit3.interrupt_client_list[irq] = interrupt_client;
01577 
01578     local_interrupt_client->interrupt_client = interrupt_client;
01579     local_interrupt_client->next = dev_prop->local_interrupt_client;
01580     dev_prop->local_interrupt_client = local_interrupt_client;
01581 
01582     DEBUG_INT(printk(KERN_DEBUG 
01583         "vme interrupt is registered, "
01584         "irq: %d, vector: 0x%04x, pid: %d, signal: %d.\n",
01585         irq, vector, task->pid, signal_id
01586     ));
01587 
01588     return 0;
01589 }
01590 
01591 
01592 static int unregister_interrupt_notification(struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop, struct task_struct* task, int irq, int vector)
01593 {
01594     struct interrupt_client_t *interrupt_client, *prev_interrupt_client;
01595     struct interrupt_client_t *unregistered_interrupt_client;
01596     struct local_interrupt_client_t *local_interrupt_client, *prev_local_interrupt_client;
01597     struct local_interrupt_client_t *unregistered_local_interrupt_client;
01598     int process_id;
01599     int irq_index;
01600 
01601     process_id = task->pid;
01602     for (irq_index = 1; irq_index < vmeNUMBER_OF_IRQ_LINES; irq_index++) {
01603 
01604         interrupt_client = bit3.interrupt_client_list[irq_index];
01605         prev_interrupt_client = 0;
01606         while (interrupt_client != 0) {
01607             if (
01608                 (process_id != interrupt_client->task->pid) ||
01609                 ((irq != 0) && (irq != interrupt_client->irq)) ||
01610                 ((vector != 0) && (vector != interrupt_client->vector))
01611             ){
01612                 prev_interrupt_client = interrupt_client;
01613                 interrupt_client = interrupt_client->next;
01614                 continue;
01615             }
01616 
01617             DEBUG_INT(printk(KERN_DEBUG 
01618                 "vme interrupt is unregistered, "
01619                 "irq: %d, vector: 0x%04x, pid: %d.\n",
01620                 interrupt_client->irq, interrupt_client->vector, process_id
01621             ));
01622 
01623             unregistered_interrupt_client = interrupt_client;
01624             interrupt_client = interrupt_client->next;
01625             if (prev_interrupt_client == 0) {
01626                 bit3.interrupt_client_list[irq_index] = interrupt_client;
01627             }
01628             else {
01629                 prev_interrupt_client->next = interrupt_client;
01630             }
01631 
01632             local_interrupt_client = dev_prop->local_interrupt_client;
01633             prev_local_interrupt_client = 0;
01634             while (local_interrupt_client != 0) {
01635                 if (local_interrupt_client->interrupt_client != unregistered_interrupt_client) {
01636                     prev_local_interrupt_client = local_interrupt_client;
01637                     local_interrupt_client = local_interrupt_client->next;
01638                     continue;
01639                 }
01640                     
01641                 unregistered_local_interrupt_client = local_interrupt_client;
01642                 local_interrupt_client = local_interrupt_client->next;
01643                 if (prev_local_interrupt_client == 0) {
01644                     dev_prop->local_interrupt_client = local_interrupt_client;
01645                 }
01646                 else {
01647                     prev_local_interrupt_client->next = local_interrupt_client;
01648                 }
01649                 kfree(unregistered_local_interrupt_client);
01650             }
01651             
01652             kfree(unregistered_interrupt_client);
01653         }
01654     }
01655 
01656     return 0;
01657 }
01658 
01659 
01660 static int wait_for_interrupt_notification(struct task_struct* task, int irq, int vector, int timeout)
01661 {
01662     long remaining_time;
01663     int process_id;
01664     struct interrupt_client_t *interrupt_client;
01665     
01666     timeout *= HZ;
01667     
01668     /* find matching registered interrupt signature */
01669     process_id = task->pid;
01670     interrupt_client = bit3.interrupt_client_list[irq];
01671     while (interrupt_client != 0) {
01672         if (
01673             (process_id == interrupt_client->task->pid) &&
01674             (vector == interrupt_client->vector) &&
01675             (interrupt_client->signal_id <= 0)
01676         ){
01677             break;
01678         }
01679         interrupt_client = interrupt_client->next;
01680     }
01681     if (interrupt_client == 0)
01682     {
01683         printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: no interrupt is registered to wait for\n", vmedrv_name);
01684         return -ENODEV;
01685     }
01686     
01687     /* now process or wait for interrupt */
01688     remaining_time = wait_event_interruptible_timeout(
01689         vmedrv_vmebusirq_wait_queue, 
01690         interrupt_client->interrupt_count > 0,
01691         timeout
01692     );
01693     if (remaining_time == 0) {
01694         return -ETIMEDOUT;
01695     }
01696     if (interrupt_client->interrupt_count == 0) {
01697         return -ERESTARTSYS;
01698     }
01699     
01700     interrupt_client->interrupt_count = 0;
01701     
01702     return 1;
01703 }
01704 
01705   
01706 static int check_interrupt_notification(int irq, int vector)
01707 {
01708     int result = 0;
01709     struct interrupt_client_t *interrupt_client;
01710 
01711     interrupt_client = bit3.interrupt_client_list[irq];
01712     while (interrupt_client != 0) {
01713         if (vector == interrupt_client->vector) {
01714             result += interrupt_client->interrupt_count;
01715 
01716         }
01717         interrupt_client = interrupt_client->next;
01718     }
01719 
01720     return result;
01721 }
01722 
01723   
01724 static int clear_interrupt_notification(int irq, int vector)
01725 {
01726     struct interrupt_client_t *interrupt_client;
01727 
01728     interrupt_client = bit3.interrupt_client_list[irq];
01729     while (interrupt_client != 0) {
01730         if (vector == interrupt_client->vector) {
01731             interrupt_client->interrupt_count = 0;
01732         }
01733         interrupt_client = interrupt_client->next;
01734     }
01735 
01736     return 0;
01737 }
01738   
01739 
01740 static int set_interrupt_autodisable(int irq, int vector)
01741 {
01742     struct interrupt_client_t *interrupt_client;
01743 
01744     interrupt_client = bit3.interrupt_client_list[irq];
01745     while (interrupt_client != 0) {
01746         if (vector == interrupt_client->vector) {
01747             interrupt_client->autodisable_flag = 1;
01748         }
01749         interrupt_client = interrupt_client->next;
01750     }
01751 
01752     return 0;
01753 }
01754   
01755 
01756 static int set_vector_mask(int irq, int vector, int vector_mask)
01757 {
01758     struct interrupt_client_t *interrupt_client;
01759 
01760     interrupt_client = bit3.interrupt_client_list[irq];
01761     while (interrupt_client != 0) {
01762       if (vector == interrupt_client->vector) {
01763           interrupt_client->vector_mask = vector_mask;
01764       }
01765       interrupt_client = interrupt_client->next;
01766     }
01767 
01768     return 0;
01769 }
01770   
01771 static int reset_adapter(void)
01772 {
01773     iowrite8(
01774         rcRESET_ADAPTER, 
01775         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regREMOTE_COMMAND_1
01776     );
01777 
01778     return 0;
01779 }
01780 
01781 
01782 static int dma_read(struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop, char* buf, unsigned long vme_address, int count)
01783 {
01784     unsigned long pci_address, size;
01785     unsigned long uncopied_length;
01786     int direction;
01787     int result;
01788 
01789     /* allocate DMA buffer, map them (only first time) */
01790     if ((result = prepare_dma(dev_prop)) < 0) {
01791         return result;
01792     }
01793 
01794     /* set transfer size and direction */
01795     if (count > bit3.dma_buffer_size) {
01796         size = bit3.dma_buffer_size;
01797     }
01798     else {
01799         size = count;
01800     }
01801     direction = tdREAD;
01802 
01803     pci_address = bit3.dma_buffer_mapped_pci_address;
01804 
01805     result = start_dma(dev_prop, pci_address, vme_address, size, direction);
01806     if (result < 0) {
01807         return result;
01808     }
01809 
01810     dma_cache_sync(&bit3.pci_dev->dev, bit3.dma_buffer, size, DMA_FROM_DEVICE);
01811 
01812     uncopied_length = copy_to_user(buf, bit3.dma_buffer, size);
01813     if (uncopied_length > 0) {
01814         return -EFAULT;
01815     }
01816     
01817     return size;
01818 }
01819 
01820 
01821 static int dma_write(struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop, const char* buf, unsigned long vme_address, int count)
01822 {
01823     unsigned long pci_address, size;
01824     unsigned long uncopied_length;
01825     int direction;
01826     int result;
01827 
01828     /* allocate DMA buffer, map them (only first time) */
01829     if ((result = prepare_dma(dev_prop)) < 0) {
01830         return result;
01831     }
01832 
01833     /* set transfer size and direction */
01834     if (count > bit3.dma_buffer_size) {
01835         size = bit3.dma_buffer_size;
01836     }
01837     else {
01838         size = count;
01839     }
01840     direction = tdWRITE;
01841 
01842     uncopied_length = copy_from_user(bit3.dma_buffer, buf, size);
01843     if (uncopied_length > 0) {
01844         return -EFAULT;
01845     }
01846 
01847     dma_cache_sync(&bit3.pci_dev->dev, bit3.dma_buffer, size, DMA_TO_DEVICE);
01848 
01849     pci_address = bit3.dma_buffer_mapped_pci_address;
01850 
01851     result = start_dma(dev_prop, pci_address, vme_address, size, direction);
01852 
01853     return (result < 0) ? result : size;
01854 }
01855 
01856 
01857 static int prepare_dma(struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop)
01858 {
01859     /* allocate and map DMA buffer, if it has not been allocated yet.*/
01860     if (bit3.dma_buffer_size == 0) {
01861         if (allocate_dma_buffer(DMA_BUFFER_SIZE) <= 0) {
01862             printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: unable to allocate dma buffer.\n", vmedrv_name);
01863             printk(KERN_WARNING "  requested size: %d\n", DMA_BUFFER_SIZE);
01864             return -ENOMEM;
01865         }
01866         bit3.dma_buffer_mapped_pci_address = map_dma_windows(
01867              bit3.dma_buffer_bus_address, 
01868              bit3.dma_buffer_size, 
01869              /* byte swapping = */ 0
01870         );
01871     }
01872 
01873     return 0;
01874 }
01875 
01876 static int start_dma(struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop, unsigned long pci_address, unsigned long vme_address, unsigned long size, int direction)
01877 {
01878     unsigned status;
01879     long timeout, remaining_time;
01880     int error_interrupt_count_before_dma;
01881 
01882     /* set DMA registers, and start */
01883     initiate_dma(dev_prop, pci_address, vme_address, size, direction);
01884     DEBUG_DMA(printk(KERN_DEBUG "now start dma transfer...\n"));
01885 
01886     error_interrupt_count_before_dma = error_interrupt_count;
01887 
01888     /* wait for DMA DONE interrupt */
01889     timeout = ((size*HZ)/100000 + HZ/10); /* 100kB/sec+100msec; slow enough */
01890     remaining_time = wait_event_timeout(
01891         vmedrv_dmadone_wait_queue, 
01892         (! is_dma_running),
01893         timeout
01894     );
01895     if (is_dma_running) {
01896         /* clear the DMA Command Register */
01897         /* this is done in the interrupt handler, but not for timeout */
01898         iowrite8(0, bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regDMA_COMMAND);  
01899 
01900         printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: dma transfer timed out.\n", vmedrv_name);
01901         release_dma();
01902         return -ETIMEDOUT;
01903     }
01904 
01905     /* release DMA settings */
01906     DEBUG_DMA(printk(KERN_DEBUG "dma transfer completed.\n"));    
01907     status = release_dma();
01908 
01909     /* release DMA settings */
01910     if (status & lsERROR_BITS) {
01911         printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: dma transfer failed.\n", vmedrv_name);
01912         printk(KERN_WARNING "  Local Status Register: 0x%02x\n", status);
01913         return -EIO;
01914     }
01915     if (error_interrupt_count != error_interrupt_count_before_dma) {
01916         status = local_status_on_error;
01917         printk(KERN_WARNING "%s: error during dma transfer.\n", vmedrv_name);
01918         printk(KERN_WARNING "  Local Status Register: 0x%02x\n", status);
01919         return -EIO;
01920     }
01921 
01922     return 0;
01923 }
01924 
01925 
01926 static void* allocate_dma_buffer(unsigned long size)
01927 {
01928     dma_addr_t dma_handle;
01929 
01930     if (size > bit3_DMA_MAPPING_SIZE) {
01931         size = bit3_DMA_MAPPING_SIZE;
01932     }
01933 
01934     bit3.dma_buffer = pci_alloc_consistent(
01935         bit3.pci_dev, size, &dma_handle
01936     );
01937 
01938     if (bit3.dma_buffer > 0) {
01939         bit3.dma_buffer_size = size;
01940         bit3.dma_buffer_bus_address = dma_handle;
01941 
01942         DEBUG_DMA(printk(KERN_DEBUG "dma buffer is allocated.\n"));
01943         DEBUG_DMA(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  size: 0x%lx.\n", bit3.dma_buffer_size));
01944         DEBUG_DMA(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  virtual address: 0x%08lx.\n", (long) bit3.dma_buffer));
01945         DEBUG_DMA(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  bus address: 0x%08lx.\n", (long) bit3.dma_buffer_bus_address));
01946     }
01947 
01948     return bit3.dma_buffer;
01949 }
01950 
01951 
01952 static void release_dma_buffer(void)
01953 {
01954     if (bit3.dma_buffer_size > 0) {
01955         pci_free_consistent(
01956             bit3.pci_dev, bit3.dma_buffer_size, 
01957             bit3.dma_buffer, bit3.dma_buffer_bus_address
01958         );
01959         bit3.dma_buffer_size = 0;
01960         DEBUG_DMA(printk(KERN_DEBUG "dma buffer is released.\n"));
01961     }
01962 }
01963 
01964 
01965 static unsigned map_dma_windows(unsigned pci_address, unsigned size, unsigned flags) 
01966 {
01967     unsigned base_address, offset_address;
01968     unsigned number_of_windows;
01969     unsigned window_index;
01970     void* mapping_register_address;
01971     unsigned mapped_pci_address;
01972     int i;
01973 
01974     base_address = pci_address & bit3_DMA_PAGE_BASE_MASK;
01975     offset_address = pci_address & bit3_DMA_PAGE_OFFSET_MASK;
01976     number_of_windows = ((unsigned long) (size - 1)) / (unsigned long) bit3_DMA_WINDOW_SIZE + 1;
01977     if (offset_address > 0) {
01978         number_of_windows += 1;
01979     }
01980 
01981     window_index = 0;
01982     mapping_register_address = (
01983         bit3.dma_mapping_registers_base + 
01984         bit3_DMA_MAPPING_REGISTER_WIDTH * window_index
01985     );
01986 
01987     DEBUG_DMA(printk(KERN_DEBUG "writing dma mapping registers...\n"));
01988     for (i = 0; i < number_of_windows; i++) {
01989         iowrite32(
01990             base_address | flags, 
01991             mapping_register_address
01992         );
01993 
01994         DEBUG_DMA(printk(
01995              KERN_DEBUG "  reg: 0x%08x, value: 0x%08x\n", 
01996              (unsigned) mapping_register_address, 
01997              base_address | flags
01998         ));
01999 
02000         base_address += bit3_DMA_WINDOW_SIZE;
02001         mapping_register_address += bit3_DMA_MAPPING_REGISTER_WIDTH;
02002     }
02003 
02004     mapped_pci_address = window_index << bit3_DMA_MAPPING_REGISTER_INDEX_SHIFT;
02005     mapped_pci_address |= offset_address;
02006 
02007     DEBUG_DMA(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  mapped pci address: 0x%08x\n", mapped_pci_address));
02008 
02009     return mapped_pci_address;
02010 }
02011 
02012 
02013 static int initiate_dma(struct dev_prop_t* dev_prop, unsigned mapped_pci_address, unsigned vme_address, unsigned size, int direction)
02014 {
02015     unsigned remainder_count, packet_count;
02016     unsigned dma_register_value, address_modifier, remote_command2_value;
02017     
02018     DEBUG_DMA(printk(KERN_DEBUG "setting dma parameters...\n"));
02019 
02020     /* program the Local DMA Command Register */
02021     dma_register_value = dcENABLE_DMA_DONE_INTERRUPT;
02022     if (direction == tdREAD) {
02023         dma_register_value |= dcDMA_TRANSFER_DIRECTION_READ;
02024     }
02025     else {
02026         dma_register_value |= dcDMA_TRANSFER_DIRECTION_WRITE;
02027     }
02028     if (dev_prop->data_width == dwWORD) {
02029         dma_register_value |= dcDMA_WORD_LONGWORD_SELECT_WORD;
02030     }
02031     else {
02032         dma_register_value |= dcDMA_WORD_LONGWORD_SELECT_LONGWORD;
02033     }
02034     iowrite8(
02035         dma_register_value,
02036         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regDMA_COMMAND
02037     );
02038     DEBUG_DMA(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  dma reg value: 0x%02x\n", dma_register_value));
02039 
02040     /* program the Local DMA Address Register */
02041     iowrite8(
02042         (mapped_pci_address >> 0) & 0x000000ff,
02043         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regDMA_PCI_ADDRESS_2_7
02044     );
02045     iowrite8(
02046         (mapped_pci_address >> 8) & 0x000000ff,
02047         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regDMA_PCI_ADDRESS_8_15
02048     );
02049     iowrite8(
02050         (mapped_pci_address >> 16) & 0x000000ff,
02051         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regDMA_PCI_ADDRESS_16_23
02052     );
02053     DEBUG_DMA(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  mapped pci address: 0x%08x\n", mapped_pci_address));
02054         
02055     /* load the Remote DMA Address Register */
02056     iowrite8(
02057         (vme_address >> 0) & 0x000000ff,
02058         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regDMA_VME_ADDRESS_0_7
02059     );
02060     iowrite8(
02061         (vme_address >> 8) & 0x000000ff,
02062         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regDMA_VME_ADDRESS_8_15
02063     );
02064     iowrite8(
02065         (vme_address >> 16) & 0x000000ff,
02066         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regDMA_VME_ADDRESS_16_23
02067     );
02068     iowrite8(
02069         (vme_address >> 24) & 0x000000ff,
02070         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regDMA_VME_ADDRESS_24_31
02071     );
02072 
02073     DEBUG_DMA(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  vme address: 0x%08x\n", vme_address));
02074 
02075     /* load the Remainder/Packet Count Register */
02076     remainder_count = size % bit3_DMA_PACKET_SIZE;
02077     packet_count = size / bit3_DMA_PACKET_SIZE;
02078     iowrite8(
02079         remainder_count,
02080         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regDMA_REMOTE_REMAINDER_COUNT
02081     );
02082     iowrite8(
02083         remainder_count,
02084         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regDMA_REMAINDER_COUNT
02085     );
02086     iowrite8(
02087         (packet_count >> 0) & 0x00ff,
02088         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regDMA_PACKET_COUNT_0_7
02089     );
02090     iowrite8(
02091         (packet_count >> 8) & 0x00ff,
02092         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regDMA_PACKET_COUNT_8_15
02093     );
02094     DEBUG_DMA(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  remainder count: 0x%02x\n", remainder_count));
02095     DEBUG_DMA(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  packet count: 0x%04x\n", packet_count));
02096 
02097     /* program the other CSRs */
02098     if (dev_prop->transfer_method == tmDMA) {
02099         address_modifier = dev_prop->dma_address_modifier;
02100         remote_command2_value = rcBLOCK_MODE_DMA | rcDISABLE_INTERRUPT_PASSING;
02101     }
02102     else /* Non-Blocking DMA */ {
02103         address_modifier = dev_prop->address_modifier;
02104         remote_command2_value = rcDISABLE_INTERRUPT_PASSING;
02105     }
02106     writeb(
02107         address_modifier,
02108         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regADDRESS_MODIFIER
02109     );
02110     writeb(
02111         remote_command2_value,
02112         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regREMOTE_COMMAND_2
02113     );
02114     DEBUG_DMA(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  dma am code: 0x%02x\n", dev_prop->dma_address_modifier));
02115     DEBUG_DMA(printk(KERN_DEBUG "  remote command 2: 0x%02x\n", remote_command2_value));
02116 
02117     /* enable normal interrupt*/
02118     save_interrupt_flags();
02119     enable_normal_interrupt();
02120 
02121     /* now, start the DMA transfer */
02122     is_dma_running = 1;
02123     wmb();
02124     iowrite8(
02125         dma_register_value | dcSTART_DMA,
02126         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regDMA_COMMAND
02127     );
02128     
02129     return 0;
02130 }
02131 
02132 
02133 static int release_dma(void)
02134 {
02135     unsigned status;
02136 
02137     status = ioread8(bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regLOCAL_STATUS);
02138     DEBUG_DMA(printk(KERN_DEBUG "Local Status Register: 0x%02x\n", status));
02139 
02140     rmb();
02141     iowrite8(lcCLEAR_STATUS, bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regLOCAL_COMMAND);
02142 
02143     /* restore VME interrupt flags */
02144     restore_interrupt_flags();
02145     iowrite8(
02146         0,
02147         bit3.mapped_node_io_base + regREMOTE_COMMAND_2
02148     );
02149     
02150     return status;
02151 }
